name: Hotel Morrison 84

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Morrison has good reviews on Tripadvisor, and frankly we were somewhat disappointed when we booked on the basis of those reviews. . Fortunately on our second stay in Bogota we stayed at Casa Real, and the differences were very significant. So see my review of Casa Real.
reviews.title: A clean safe place to sleep

reviews.text: As noted by other reviewers, Hotel Morrison is located in an area of restaurants and stores. We felt very safe in the area as we did in other areas we went to in Colombia. The breakfast was very good, and we had access to internet which was much appreciated. We had no issues with the hotel staff.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay in Bogota

reviews.text: However the room was very small- about 12 X 12 feet. Between the bed, desk and dresser, there was little space and stubbing your toe on the bed support was easily achieved. There was no comfortable chair to relax and read a paper.
reviews.title: Great Time!

reviews.text: The bathroom was less than 5X5 feet plus a shower with a questionable shower head. The towels were "hard". The bed mattress was also hard and not very comfortable. A litre of water was approximately $4-5 US.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: This is purely a business hotel- a place to sleep and no more. It was not a good refuge from an active day of touring Bogota.
reviews.title: a great find!

description: English-style Hotel situated across the Park Leon de Greiff; in commercial & cultural area of the city, convenient to Andino Mall.
